gr.interamerican.bo2.utils
Class SelectionUtils

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.utils.SelectionUtils

public class SelectionUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class with methods that select items from Collections.

SelectionUtils

public SelectionUtils()
Method Detail

max

public static <T,V extends java.lang.Comparable<? super V>> T max(java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                                                  java.lang.String propertyName)
Gets the element of a collection that has the maximum value in a specified property. Example, if the collection contains elemetns of type Person, and the class Person has a property age that is of type Integer, then calling this method on the collection with argument age for property name, would return the oldest person.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of elements in the collection.
V - Type of the property specified by propertyName
Parameters:
collection - Collection with the elements in which the element with the maximum value of an element is searched.
propertyName - Name of the property that is used for the comparison. The type of this property must be comparable with it self.
Returns:
Returns the element that has the maximum property with the name specified by propertyName in the collection. If the collection is empty, then returns null.

min

public static <T,V extends java.lang.Comparable<? super V>> T min(java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                                                  java.lang.String propertyName)
Gets the element of a collection that has the maximum value in a specified property. Example, if the collection contains elements of type Person, and the class Person has a property age that is of type Integer, then calling this method on the collection with argument age for property name, would return the oldest person.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of elements in the collection.
V - Type of the property specified by propertyName
Parameters:
collection - Collection with the elements in which the element with the maximum value of an element is searched.
propertyName - Name of the property that is used for the comparison. The type of this property must be comparable with it self.
Returns:
Returns the element that has the maximum property with the name specified by propertyName in the collection. If the collection is empty, then returns null.

selectByProperty

public static <S,T extends S> java.util.List<T> selectByProperty(java.lang.String property,
                                                                 java.lang.Object value,
                                                                 java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                                                 java.lang.Class<S> type)
Gets the items with the specified name from a collection of object's that have a property name.

Type Parameters:
S - Type of objects in the collection.
T - Class to evaluate the property with. Must be a super-type of T.
Parameters:
property - Name of property being used as selection criterion.
value - Value of selection criterion. It can be null.
collection - Collection of objects.
type - Type of objects in the collection.
Returns:
Returns a list with all elements of the specified collection that have the specified property equal to the specified value.

selectByName

public static <S,T extends S> java.util.List<T> selectByName(java.lang.String name,
                                                             java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                                             java.lang.Class<S> type)
Gets the items with the specified name from a collection of object's that have a property name.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of objects in the collection.
S - Class to evaluate the property with. Must be a super-type of T.
Parameters:
name - Name being searched.
collection - Collection of objects.
type - Type of objects in the collection.
Returns:
Returns a list with all elements of the specified collection that have the specified name.

selectFirstByProperty

public static <T> T selectFirstByProperty(java.lang.String property,
                                          java.lang.Object value,
                                          java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                          java.lang.Class<T> type)
Gets the first item with the specified property from a collection of object's that have a property name.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of objects in the collection.
Parameters:
property - Name of property being used as selection criterion.
value - Value of selection criterion. It can be null.
collection - Collection of objects.
type - Type of objects in the collection.
Returns:
Returns a list with all elements of the specified collection that have the specified property equal to the specified value.

selectFirstByProperties

public static <T> T selectFirstByProperties(java.lang.String[] properties,
                                            java.lang.Object[] values,
                                            java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                            java.lang.Class<T> type)
Selects the first element of the specified collection that has the specified properties equal to the specified values.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
properties -
values -
collection -
type -
Returns:
Returns the first element of the specified collection that has the specified properties equal to the specified values. If there is no element in the collection to fulfill the condition, then returns null.

selection

public static <T> T selection(boolean flag,
                              T trueValue,
                              T falseValue)
Selects between two values, based on a boolean flag.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of values
Parameters:
flag - Flag that determines which value will be selected.
trueValue - Return value if flag is true
falseValue - Return value if flag is false
Returns:
Returns one of the two values, according to the boolean value of the specified flag being true or false.

existsByProperty

public static <T> java.lang.Boolean existsByProperty(java.lang.String property,
                                                     java.lang.Object value,
                                                     java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                                     java.lang.Class<T> type)
Checks if the specified collection contains at least one element that has the specified property equal to the specified value.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of collection elements.
Parameters:
property - Property on which the check is made
value - Value to check against
collection - Collection
type - Class of collection elements.
Returns:
Returns true, if there is at least one element in the collection whose property is equal to the supplied value.

existsByCondition

public static <T> java.lang.Boolean existsByCondition(Condition<T> condition,
                                                      java.util.Collection<T> collection)
Checks if the specified collection contains at least one element that fulfills the specified condition.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
condition -
collection -
Returns:
Returns true if there is at least one element in the specified collection that fulfills the specified condition.
